title: We Need More CC and Little Damage Champions In the Game
body:
Right now, the game is really dominated by damage in each role. Top Lane has to either be dealing tons of damage to carry or having huge damage reduction to block the carries. Middle Lane is all about roaming pressure, especially Bottom Lane, meaning that they have to have tons of quick damage. ADC has always been damage focused, but that is it's purpose. Support has become all about damage mitigation to weaken the extreme amounts of damage being thrown around. Jungle has become this weird ball of champions, which is fine, but you still hardly see CC focused junglers like Amumu and Sejuani played a ton.

What I'm saying is that we need more champions in this game that are entirely about disabling enemy champions. Right now, we have about 8, being:
{{champion:12}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:20}} {{champion:113}} 
Only about 3 of these champions are currently being used due to nerfs or innate flaws in their kits. Note that I said entirely about CC, not CC+Damage. There are some champions that can disable enemy champions nearly as good as these guys while ALSO dealing tons of damage, but that is another story. What I want to focus on is the lack of CC focused champions. Most Initiate champions these days are all about that initial BURST of damage they provide, not some team crippling crowd control. The only champions that are currently somewhat like that are Hecarim and Gragas, but even they are more known for their pretty crippling damage along with their crowd control.

TL;DR We need more Disable focused champions. Not Disable+Damage, but pure Disable focused champions.

**I think CC is in a very, very healthy state right now.**

On the subject of some of these being 'Too Bursty'.... I think that many CC-focused champions bring potential burst and tankiness to the table. You can easily build Amumu as a terrifying DOT bruiser, or a core tank, that destroys teams with one well placed ult... One of leagues strengths is that champion versatility. 

**One thing i WOULD like to see, is a new item that lets players sacrifice some core stats for the ability to CC a target. **

I would like a counter effect/stat/item or whatever to Tenacity. Right now, you can easily nearly half the duration of all non-airborne or Suppression effects with a pair of boots and a Mastery. That seems a little ridiculous to me and is likely why many champions with stuns, fears, and such are often outclassed by champions with airborne effects unless they have some form of intense potential burst damage to go with it or support utility. We don't really have any pure disable champions that can't also pull off some insane burst or also provided healing or combat stats to their team. The closest champion to that is Nautilus really.

Nunu? Amumu?
Pfft
Their full ap builds are insane

All champions can build an Attack Speed+Attack Damage and deal decent sustained damage, especially if Ranged. Likewise, champions that don't have absolutely hideous ratios or next to none (see Mundo) can all build AP to deal some decent burst damage.

Once you start creating kits that are almost all CC, you run into the issue of overlapping champion identities. And even if there were more choices, they wouldn't be picked any more than they do now because they just fill the same role as the people who already weren't getting picked (and only the strongest would see play)

I would also argue that amumu, malph, and nunu do not really fit the paradigm you set up. They're pretty much just one-trick champs with all their power in their ults, as opposed to being CC bots.

The issue with doing this is not making them obsolete or too powerful when that type of champion already exists within league and having champions of such an extreme nature is not productive to the game's balance nor is it ideal.
